body:
Comment 1 by **andrew@spacemonkey.com**: 
I failed to mention, the behavior with syscall is a bit different although the final
crash is due to the same code.  The interesting part is that the same function foo(),
invoked via syscall, first somehow hits the runtime.sighandler with the access violation
and then the vectored handler is called again (this time with no g associated with the
thread)
